intro: Fagara dellomei, commonly known as the Jamaican black pepper plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly Jamaica, and is characterized by its dark, peppery fruits. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered. The fruit, which is used in traditional medicine, contains essential oils and has a sharp, pungent flavor.
